answerText: Siméon Denis Poisson[10] This quantity, sometimes symbolized G, is equal to the elastic modulus divided by two times the quantity one plus the Poisson ratio. This quantity describes a material's response to forces acting parallel to the surface of the material.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 1 | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this scientist who names a quantity equal to minus the ratio of the strain perpendicular to the load to the strain parallel to the load.
